Class TicketMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicketMachine
  • public class TicketMachine
extends Object
    TicketMachine models a ticket machine that issues flat-fare tickets. The price of a ticket is specified via the constructor. Instances will check to ensure that a user only enters sensible amounts of money, and will only print a ticket if enough money has been inputted.
    Version:
    2016.02.29 Modified by Jason Huggins Dated 16/10/2020
    Author:
    David J. Barnes and Michael Kölling

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TicketMachine()
      Creates a machine that issues tickets with the price preset to each destination's fare.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getBalance()  
      void insert100P()
      Inserts a £1 coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.
      void insert10P()
      Inserts a 10p coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.
      void insert200P()
      Inserts a £2 coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.
      void insert20P()
      Inserts a 20p coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.
      void printTicket()
      Prints a ticket if enough money has been inserted, and reduces the current balance by the ticket price.
      int refundBalance()
      Refunds the money remaining in the balance to the customer and clears the balance afterwards.
      void selectAmershamTicket()
      Selects the Amersham ticket as the ticket to be issued.
      void selectAylesburyTicket()
      Selects the Aylesbury ticket as the ticket to be issued.
      void selectHighWycombeTicket()
      Selects the High Wycombe ticket as the ticket to be issued.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicketMachine

        public TicketMachine()
        Creates a machine that issues tickets with the price preset to each destination's fare. All available tickets that are purchasable are shown to the customer.

    • Method Detail

      • selectAylesburyTicket

        public void selectAylesburyTicket()
        Selects the Aylesbury ticket as the ticket to be issued.

      • selectAmershamTicket

        public void selectAmershamTicket()
        Selects the Amersham ticket as the ticket to be issued.

      • selectHighWycombeTicket

        public void selectHighWycombeTicket()
        Selects the High Wycombe ticket as the ticket to be issued.

      • getBalance

        public int getBalance()
        Returns:
        the amount of money already inserted for the next ticket.

      • insert10P

        public void insert10P()
        Inserts a 10p coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.

      • insert20P

        public void insert20P()
        Inserts a 20p coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.

      • insert100P

        public void insert100P()
        Inserts a £1 coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.

      • insert200P

        public void insert200P()
        Inserts a £2 coin into the ticket machine and displays the new balance.

      • printTicket

        public void printTicket()
        Prints a ticket if enough money has been inserted, and reduces the current balance by the ticket price. An error message is printed if no ticket has been selected or more money is required.

      • refundBalance

        public int refundBalance()
        Refunds the money remaining in the balance to the customer and clears the balance afterwards.
        Returns:
        the money in the balance.
